snippet: Prosecutors are seeking to drop charges against Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the former managing director of the International Monetary Fund, in connection with a prostitution ring.
abstract: Prosecutors in Lille are seeking to drop charges against Dominique Strauss-Kahn, former managing director of International Monetary Fund, in connection with ring that recruited prostitutes for sex parties, saying there is insufficient evidence to keep him under formal investigation.
lead_paragraph: Prosecutors are seeking to drop charges against Dominique Strauss-Kahn, the former managing director of the International Monetary Fund, in connection with a prostitution ring.

headline.seo: French Prosecutors Ask to Drop Case Against Strauss-Kahn Over Prostitutes
headline.main: France: Prosecutors Ask to Drop Case Against Strauss-Kahn Over Prostitutes
headline.print_headline: France: Prosecutors Ask to Drop Case Against Strauss-Kahn Over Prostitutes
